meanings.definition: Relating to or involving multiple genes or genetic factors.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the polygenetic traits of the twins.
meanings.sent2: The polygenetic nature of the disease made it challenging to treat.
meanings.sent3: The polygenetic puzzle was like trying to solve a complex riddle.
meanings.sent4: Her family tree was a polygenetic tapestry woven with diverse genetic threads.
meanings.sent5: The polygenetic inheritance of eye color fascinated the geneticist.

meanings.definition: Originating from more than one source or ancestor.
meanings.sent1: The ancient artifact had a polygenetic history, passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: The polygenetic origins of the language reflected its rich cultural heritage.
meanings.sent3: The polygenetic mix of flavors in the dish created a unique taste sensation.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was a polygenetic bond formed from shared experiences and memories.
meanings.sent5: The polygenetic roots of the tradition connected people from different backgrounds.
